page.title: 07FARMING MIXED,PIGS & POULTRY
page.content: {BENTLEY GRANGE FARM,}EMLEY(265131) WAS FORMERLEY OWNED BY THE MONKS OF BYLAND ABBEY. IT IS NOW OWNED BY NATIONAL COAL BOARD. HAS BEEN TENANTED BY MOORHOUSE FAMILY SINCE 1889. PRESENT TENANTS MICHAEL, PAUL & BRIAN MOORHOUSE (BROTHERS). THEY WORK THE FARM THEMSELVES AND ALSO EMPLOY 1 LABOURER AND 4 LADIES TO COLLECT AND GRADE EGGS. {FARM SIZE 170 ACRES.} {CROPS GROWN}acreage in brackets. WINTER BARLEY (60) WINTER WHEAT (40) GRASS (60) STRAWBERRIES (5) RASPBERRIES (3.5). {LIVESTOCK} 8000 HENS LAYING 7000 EGGS PER DAY. 100 DUCKS LAYING 80 EGGS PER DAY. 280 PIGS (BOUGHT AT 10 WEEKS, FATTENED UP AND SOLD.) ONE BROTHER SPENDS 2.5 DAYS PER WEEK SELLING EGGS TO SHOPS ETC.
